summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs relies on a decades-old financial management system to help administer its veterans' benefit programs—including pensions, health care, and disability compensation. Since 1998, VA has been working on a replacement system. This Q&A report covers the system's rollout. VA has followed most leading practices. But the system continues to be delayed and costs have increased. Plus, VA doesn't have specific, detailed...
title: Financial Management Systems: VA Should Improve Its Risk Response Plans
